reviews.review_msg: Makes lots of errors and is inconsiderate

I found him helpful and was a good lecturer. The course was definitely not easy and assignments took forever. But I enjoyed it and got "A". He has encouraged me to do math modeling competition and other activities. However when I refused to continuing grad school at sfu, he wrote me bad references to schools that I applied. Such a terrible person.

Lectures seem delivered on spot (nevertheless relevant to the week's topic). Assignments are difficult in the sense that they do not have written solutions. Exam was a wreck for everyone. On the plus side, JF is a genius and will likely have an answer to your question. He is approachable and will give you a good mark if you put in the time.
He's really friendly and fair.  Maybe he made the course harder than it should be, but I was entertained nonetheless.  Mass scaling helped me get my grade.  Really friendly and great guy!

Petr's notes were helpful, and ultimately factored to my success in the class; however, I would not say that he's great at teaching them. He would not be super clear with why certain things worked/did not work. He also came off as rude on occasions, which may have not been intended, but was still apparent. Not bad, but definitely not great either.

Can be rude at times, but he is an okay prof. Lectures were kinf of boring and makes you want to fall asleep. LOTS of homework. Difficult homework. Apart from that, he's alright. Grading can be a bit tough but I'm doing pretty well. Overall, he's an okay prof

I am pretty sure I attended office hours every single week and he was always so so helpful and kind. His lectures can make me a little bit sleepy sometimes because he tends to repeat things often and say "um". That is probably the only negative I could say about him though. His assignments are fair and he does a great job of explaining. Very caring
The GOAT üêê amazing prof and course, can't recommend enough, YES, YES, YES just take it, okay? Or regret your life choices if you don't
Extremely fun assignments that let you apply lecture concepts in progressively complex questions
You can't ask for a better professor. Lectures? Captivating. Tutorials and labs? Inspiring. Smile and aura? Wholesome.

I've taken 3 math courses with him and all of them were phenomenal. If you have the chance to take a course with him, jump on it. MACM 204 was succinctly informative and useful. His lectures were easy to follow and the tutorials were incredibly helpful (make sure to go to the tutorials). Final was very fair and he allowed us a cheat sheet.

I had a solid experience in Monagan's MACM204 course this term. Lectures were well-paced with great examples, labs were super helpful, including the TA Garrett!! Assignments were a tad difficult, but good practice. Final was fair, as it was based on assignments and you get a 2 sided cheat sheet. He's a great prof, which is obvious from the reviews

Michael is a superb prof. I'd recommend him to anyone, he's so good at breaking down tough concepts and making them enjoyable. I always tried to make it to his lectures as they were worthwhile. Assignments are very fair too, just applications of lecture and lab material. If you're looking to improve your programming/math skills, take it for sure.

Very direct and informative lectures. Although he posts his notes, going to all lectures and labs (1 of each per week) was very helpful. Assignments are every 2 weeks, no midterms. Every skill and concept needed for the assignments are covered in class in a very clear and succinct way. He really cares whether or not you understand.

He's the best prof I have this semester. A breath of fresh air compared to all of my other profs because he is actually passionate about what he does, and it shows. Lectures are always done well with plenty of helpful examples - he's also funny! He goes out of his way to help you, even having office hours in the evening on Zoom. The GOAT for sure.

Michael Monagan has a very direct way of teaching - he gets straight to the point and doesn't add any unnecessary jargon. Very clear lectures and labs that are easy to follow, and you learn a lot. Assignments are generally fair, though there are often a couple questions that are more challenging. Overall he's great!

He's very approachable and good at delivering knowledge.His final exam was very fair and based on the assignments you did in the class. Assignments weren't insanely hard but definitely required brainpower, so take that as you will. Held multiple office hours spread throughout the week. Would highly recommend to take any class you can with him!
lectures are fine, hw can be long sometimes will need to stretch your brain, labs are really important, class was 5 assignments then a final exam, final exam was very fair

One of the best instructor which i have ever had in my entire life . The lecture is clear , helpful . His explaination is also on point . The prof really know and how to teach the material . It is like a lifetime experience for me .

Dr. Monagan's lectures are extremely clear, and office hours are helpful for any clarifications regarding assignments which while long, are reasonable. As long as you understand how to code the homework problems, there is no need to worry about the 50% final. Don't miss the opportunity to take a course with him! He'll trick you into liking coding:)
Wholesome professor and very knowledgeable in his lectures. This course focuses on a unique math software which he will guide you through with assignments to apply those skills on.
Lots of assignments. If you attend the lectures and labs, you wil be ok.

Probably one of the best professors in the math department. Very knowledgeable about the course content and math, and explains things very clearly in both lectures and labs. Highly recommend taking a course with him!
I highly recommend.

Nils Bruin is one of the best mathematical researchers that SFU has to offer, but his absolute insane stationary teaching definitely bothers some people. Never moves a needle as soon as he enters the class. Just stands at the desk and scribbles with his bluetooth pen. I would advise not sitting in the first two rows or Bruin will yell at you.

Despite being a Calculus related course, homework and final exam questions expect students to have a good understanding of Linear Algebra as well. Overall, Nils is an okay/good professor. He did scale students in the end.
